resources.string: Place the QR Code in the indicated frame

Created and maintained by two college students.
Offers a free and simple way to interact with QR codes.
The app is free and it always will be, and there will never be in-app ads.
Please do consider sharing the app with your friends though, that would help a lot.
Thank you for downloading the app,
You are awesome :D
It seems an error has occurred. Couldn\'t generate code.
No codes yet. Press New Scan to start scanning!
This cover has been designed using resources from Flaticon.com

Scan QR codes in no time and with ease!
 All scanned codes are saved in a convenient way, allowing you to keep a list of all codes.
 On the next screen, press the 'New Scan' button and place the code in the frame!
That's all it takes, so get scanning!
Code image could not be created.
All saved codes will be deleted.
This apps design has been inspired by this dribbble post.
Note:\nCreating a QR code requires an internet connection.\nAs of now, only text is supported.

The first feature update has landed!
You can now create your own QR codes! Press the plus button in the top right corner to find out more.

Other changes:
● App now doesn't render in landscape mode.
● List of codes now animates slightly.
● Increase icon sizes and touch targets.

Tap the Select image button to begin!

● Multiple codes in one image? No worries, they will all be here.
● All detected codes will be saved. You can delete the ones you don't need.
● Press X to remove codes you don't need, the rest are saved automatically!

Consider supporting our work and fueling out late night coding sessions with one of the options below.\n\nOur apps are free and open source, so this would really help us out! Thank You for using our app :D

Thank you for using our app!
If you like what we do, consider supporting our work by buying us a cup of coffee.

The app is free and always will be, this is just a little something to keep us going.
You can create codes of different types.\nSelect one of the types below to get started.
